Comment: And yet another annotation from freddy's second project.  We pick up the story at the 9th move.

It was expected that White would move Ne6, as this has been a most utilized move.  However, the White Liege deploys his other Knight to what he thought to be the safe and protected confines of c3.
The DSB, pure of heart, knows this Knight doth harbor evil intent.  And as such, he takes decisive action.  In so doing, he lays down his life for his King.
Black's quiet foot soldier informs White's LSB that his presence is a blight upon all that is good.
Black's quiet foot soldier informs White's LSB that his presence is a blight upon all that is good.
Rather rudely, the LSB further immerses himself in Black's demesne.  His presence here was not planned upon and caused fear among Black's populace.
The bugles sound as The Black Knight enters into the foray.  The King, brave to a fault, does not seek safety.
White's DSB comes forth, further constricting Black's King.
Hooray!  The Black Knight rides to his King's defense.

An ominous portent, this.  White's rook threatens Her Ladyship.  The Black King has foolishly refused to move to safety.  These are dangerous times.  Black's Queen sends word of her plan to Her King and Sir Knight.  They are aghast--"No fair Lady, I beg thee! Do not do this thing!"  The Queen, her eyes fierce and hard, brooks no defiance.  "I do what you know I must and nothing less than what you would do were you in my place.  White is strangling our land and our people."  Sir Knight, tears in his eyes, nods and does his duty.
They will sing songs of your bravery, My Lady.
They will sing songs of your bravery, My Lady.
They will sing songs of your bravery, My Lady.
Sir Knight hastens back to the field!
Sir Knight hastens back to the field!
Black's rook claims the file for his people.
Black's rook claims the file for his people.
And finally, after the loss of his Queen, the King realizes that his safety is paramount.
And finally, after the loss of his Queen, the King realizes that his safety is paramount.
White's Knight looks to fork Black's rooks or perhaps attack the foot soldier at g6.

Prevented.
With this move, Black's rook at g8 thinks mayhap there be a chance to simplify.  Though this may cost him his life, he is content in the knowledge that he will soon be with his Queen.
With grim determination, the Rook on d8 bids farewell to his brother Rook--and strikes into the heart of White!

"For my Queen!" exalts Sir Knight!
"For my Queen!" exalts Sir Knight!
"For my Queen!" exalts Sir Knight!
"For my Queen!" exalts Sir Knight!
"What is this?" asks a surprised foot soldier--"I will gladly exchange my life for yours."
